info.title: Barclays Bank Ireland Payment Initiation
info.description: Initiates a single immediate or scheduled/future dated SEPA or cross border payment with the consent of the customer

post.description: Initiate Cross Border Credit Transfer Payment

parameters.name: X-Request-ID
parameters.description: Request ID used for E2E tracking

schema.description: Request ID used for E2E tracking

parameters.name: PSU-IP-Port
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Port header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Port field between PSU and TPP, if available.

schema.description: The forwarded IP Port header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Port field between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

schema.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Charset
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

schema.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Encoding
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

schema.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-User-Agent
parameters.description: The forwarded Agent header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available.

schema.description: The forwarded Agent header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Language
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

schema.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Http-Method
parameters.description:
HTTP method used at the interface between PSU and TPP, if available. Valid values are:
- GET
- POST
- PUT
- PATCH
- DELETE

schema.description:
HTTP method used at the interface between PSU and TPP, if available. Valid values are:
- GET
- POST
- PUT
- PATCH
- DELETE

parameters.name: PSU-Device-ID
parameters.description: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available. UUID identifies either a device or a device dependent application installation. In case of an installation identification this ID needs to be unaltered until removal from device.

schema.description: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available. UUID identifies either a device or a device dependent application installation. In case of an installation identification this ID needs to be unaltered until removal from device.

parameters.name: PSU-Geo-Location
parameters.description: The forwarded Geo Location of the corresponding HTTP request between PSU and TPP if available.

schema.description: The forwarded Geo Location of the corresponding HTTP request between PSU and TPP if available.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Standard HTTP Header; Represents the format of the payload being returned in the response.

schema.description: Standard HTTP Header; Represents the format of the payload being returned in the response.

parameters.name: PSU-IP-Address
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Address header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Address field between PSU and TPP.

schema.description: The forwarded IP Address header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Address field between PSU and TPP.

parameters.name: PSU-ID
parameters.description: Client ID of the PSU in the ASPSP client interface.

schema.description: Client ID of the PSU in the ASPSP client interface.

parameters.name: PSU-ID-Type
parameters.description: Type of the PSU-ID, needed in scenarios where PSUs have several PSU-IDs as access possibility.

schema.description: Type of the PSU-ID, needed in scenarios where PSUs have several PSU-IDs as access possibility.

parameters.name: PSU-Corporate-ID
parameters.description: Corporate ID - Only used in a corporate context.

schema.description: Corporate ID - Only used in a corporate context.

parameters.name: PSU-Corporate-ID-Type
parameters.description: Type of corporate - Only used in a corporate context.

schema.description: Type of corporate - Only used in a corporate context.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description: Is contained only if the "Signature" element is contained in the header of the request.

schema.description: Is contained only if the "Signature" element is contained in the header of the request.

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: A signature of the request by the TPP on application level.

schema.description: A signature of the request by the TPP on application level.

parameters.name: TPP-Redirect-Preferred
parameters.description:
If it equals true, the TPP prefers a Redirect over Decoupled SCA approach. If it equals false, Decoupled SCA Approach will be applied.
IMPORTANT: Currently, Implicit Redirect SCA Approach is supported, so TPP-Redirect-Preferred must equal true.

schema.description:
If it equals true, the TPP prefers a Redirect over Decoupled SCA approach. If it equals false, Decoupled SCA Approach will be applied.
IMPORTANT: Currently, Implicit Redirect SCA Approach is supported, so TPP-Redirect-Preferred must equal true.

parameters.name: TPP-Redirect-URI
parameters.description: URI of the TPP, where the transaction flow shall be redirected to after a Redirect. It is mandatory for the Redirect SCA Approach (including OAuth2 SCA approach).

schema.description: URI of the TPP, where the transaction flow shall be redirected to after a Redirect. It is mandatory for the Redirect SCA Approach (including OAuth2 SCA approach).

parameters.name: TPP-Nok-Redirect-URI
parameters.description: If this URI is contained, the TPP is asking to redirect the transaction flow to this address instead of the TPP-Redirect-URI in case of a negative result of the redirect SCA method.

schema.description: If this URI is contained, the TPP is asking to redirect the transaction flow to this address instead of the TPP-Redirect-URI in case of a negative result of the redirect SCA method.

parameters.name: PSU-Device-ID
parameters.description: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available. UUID identifies either a device or a device dependent application installation. In case of an installation identification this ID needs to be unaltered until removal from device.
